member.name: Windows.MFPCreateMediaPlayer

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
summary.para: Creates a new instance of the MFPlay player object.

param.name: pwszURL
param.para: Null-terminated string that contains the URL of a media file to open. This parameter can be NULL. If the parameter is NULL, fStartPlayback must be FALSE.
If this parameter is NULL, you can open a URL later by calling .

param.name: fStartPlayback
param.para: If TRUE, playback starts automatically. If FALSE, playback does not start until the application calls .
If pwszURL is NULL, this parameter is ignored.

member.param: Bitwise OR of zero of more flags from the enumeration.

Pointer to the interface of a callback object, implemented by the application. Use this interface to get event notifications from the MFPlay player object. This parameter can be NULL. If the parameter is NULL, the application will not receive event notifications from the player object.

param.name: hWnd
param.para: A handle to a window where the video will appear. For audio-only playback, this parameter can be NULL.
The window specified by hWnd is used for the first selected video stream in the source. If the source has multiple video streams, you must call to render any of the video streams after the first.
If hWnd is NULL, MFPlay will not display any video unless the application calls to specify a media sink for the video stream.

member.param: Receives a pointer to the interface. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL. If this parameter is NULL, fStartPlayback must be TRUE and pwszURL cannot be NULL.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.div: Important Deprecated. This API may be removed from future releases of Windows. Applications should use the Media Session for playback.
